summary: This document is a chain of emails from January 4, 2021, between staff at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) discussing a media inquiry from a New York Post reporter. The reporter is seeking a search warrant affidavit from the District of New Hampshire that was used to track Ghislaine Maxwell's cellphone to a New Hampshire property prior to her arrest. The emails confirm the warrant is no longer sealed and discuss how to provide it.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Subject of the search warrant and arrest discussed in the emails; her cellphone was tracked to a New Hampshire property.

persons.name: Rebecca Rosenberg
persons.context: New York Post reporter who contacted the SDNY Public Information Officer seeking the unsealed search warrant affidavit related to Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Nick
persons.context: Mentioned as having looked in the District of New Hampshire docket for the search warrant document.

events.title: FBI files search warrant application for cellphone tracking
events.description: An FBI agent filed an affidavit in support of a search warrant application to track Ghislaine Maxwell's cellphone, leading to her location at a New Hampshire property.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested by the FBI at a secluded mansion in Bradford, New Hampshire, one day after the search warrant application was filed.

events.title: Sealing order lapses
events.description: The sealing order on the cellphone tracking warrant from the District of New Hampshire lapsed, making the warrant no longer sealed.

events.title: Media inquiry about unsealed warrant
events.description: New York Post reporter Rebecca Rosenberg contacted the SDNY seeking the newly unsealed search warrant affidavit related to Ghislaine Maxwell's tracking and arrest.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY (Southern District of New York)
keyFacts: The FBI tracked Ghislaine Maxwell to a New Hampshire hideaway using her cellphone data, as detailed in a search warrant affidavit filed on July 1, 2020.
Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, at a nearly $1 million secluded mansion in Bradford, New Hampshire.
The sealing order on the cellphone tracking warrant from the District of New Hampshire lapsed in December 2020, making the warrant publicly accessible.
A New York Post reporter was actively seeking the unsealed affidavit in January 2021, indicating ongoing media and public interest in the details of Maxwell's capture.
The warrant did not contain sensitive information about witnesses or the ongoing investigation, which is why the government did not seek to keep it sealed.
